lines.text: I let go of everything I ever had
'Cause I couldn't give the love you deserved
By The Gunner, you shouted, "Oh my god"

annotations.text: The Gunner is a pub located in North Shields, England, where Sam Fender grew up. Despite not yet confirming whether this is the place he is referring to in this lyric, its location makes it highly likely.

lines.text: It seemed churlish, but it's what I was owed, I suppose

annotations.text: Churlish behaviour can be described as unfriendly, bad-tempered, or impolite.

lines.text: Every flagstone of this town bears our prints
And all the bars round here serve my ghosts and carcasses

annotations.text:
it is interesting he used the word carcass here instead of just corpse. Carcasses describe the dead body of an animal.
This links to the animalistic imagery of being “reined in”. Perhaps suggesting he felt reined and tamed like a trapped animal.

lines.text: I wish I knew these things when I was young

annotations.text: I wish I knew these things when I was young, means i wish i knew this before now obvay x

lines.text: 'Cause now I've just gone so numb
We take whatever we can to get the reason back
So plеase don't rein me in
Don't rеin me in
Please don't rein me in
I'm working myself up to a nice, warm bliss

annotations.text: Either he’s either gone out on a drinking session to take his mind off her, or this is one of the most poetic descriptions of masturbation I’ve ever heard in a song.

lines.text: All my memories of you ring like tinnitus

annotations.text:
Tinnitus is the medical term for hearing noises which originate from inside of the body rather than externally. It is commonly described as a ringing sound; however, it can also be a buzzing, humming or hissing noise. It can be constant or temporary, and it can present at different volumes and frequencies. There is currently no cure but, for some people, it does improve with time.

In this lyric, Sam Fender uses tinnitus to highlight the constant, bothersome nature of his memories with this person. He cannot ignore them, regardless of how much he might try to. They will always linger in his mind.

lines.text: If I stop, it's just pain, please don't rein me in
There's nothing brave in walking alone
Love in exile has nowhere to go, so come on home
Mm, don't run away from my tenderness
You're so afraid of that heart inside of your chest

annotations.text:
You’re so afraid of that heart inside your chest" refers to being emotionally closed off, avoiding vulnerability, or fearing deep feelings (love, pain, connection) due to past hurt or insecurity, in Sam Fender’s song “Rein Me In,” where it suggests someone is masking pain with pride or avoidance instead of processing emotions. It’s about keeping your true self hidden because opening up feels scary.
imagine masking your true self so much to the point where u are literally afraid to love, afraid of that heart inside YOUR CHEST. DONT BE AFRAID TO LOVE GUYS

lines.text: We were doing so well, but you were scared to be held

annotations.text:
Here, Dean’s words mirror Fender’s lyrics at the beginning of the first verse:

”And I let go of everything I ever had
Cause I couldn’t give the love you deserve”

Fender tells us how he ended a relationship due to his own struggles, and the fact he believed he couldn’t fulfil a relationship with someone.

However, Dean offers a counter to this. In this song, she gives a different perspective to Fender’s original lyrics. This reflects their different attachment styles: Fender being avoidant.

She believed the relationship to be doing well and it seemed to her that he got cold feet out of nowhere, without offering her a proper explanation. This perspective speaks of someone being left in the dark, and maybe not fully understanding their partner’s feelings. She comes to a conclusion that they ended the relationship as he was ’scared to be held’, inferring that he was not really ready for a relationship. She sees this as a poor way to end the relationship: it was the ’easiest way out’.

lines.text: Took the easiest way out
I see the tears of a man too proud to reach for a hand
Well, let my love keep you safe now
So please don't

result.type: Chorus: Sam Fender & Olivia Dean, Sam Fender

lines.text: Don't rein me in

annotations.text:
I feel like this song represents two lovers with opposing attachment styles. Sam Fender representing the avoidant and Olivia Dean representing the anxious.
In this line, it’s almost like Sam Fender is saying “don’t rein me in” as in don’t put reins and chains on me, let me have my space, let me take my time, let me breathe.
And Olivia Dean is singing “don’t rein me in” like don’t make me love less hard, don’t push me away, let me love you with my full heart.
This might be a niche interpretation but I just thought I woukd share :)

And I'm, I'm stood here chewing everyone's lugs off

annotations.text: “Lugs” is English slang for ears. He is telling people about this relationship ad nauseam, or “talking everyone’s ears off”

lines.text: Telling everybody how much I fucked it up
Telling everybody how much I fucked it up
Telling everybody but you how much I fucked it up
Slow down (Don't rein me in)

result.type: Chorus: Both, Sam Fender, Olivia Dean
